_header: At high noon when the bell doth toll
_description: On the midday Angelus — four cross-rhymed quatrains and concluding couplet

Yates.First Lines:
At hygh none whan the belle dothe tylleIn mynde of crystys byttur
                    passyon…
Yates.Last Lines:
…J H U for thy holy name and thy byttur passionSave me fro
                    synne and shame and eals thyne [dapcion?]
Yates.Note:
Transcription from Axon (1892)
XAxon,  William Edward Armytage. 
             “The Symbolism of the ‘Five Wounds of Christ’.” 
             Transactions of the Lancashire and Chesire Antiquarian Society
         10 (1892): 67-77.
